page.title: 17LOCAL CONCERNS
page.content: Their local concerns are much the same as elsewhere: the cost of living and the weather. Of particular concern from time to time is the E.E.C. and the effect of regulations upon local farming. The current question of creating the Pennines as a conservation area of great natural beauty could also affect farming and bring about more unwanted regulations. Another very current anxiety is the proposed closure by British Rail of the Settle-Carlisle Railway, and many local people are involved with the protest movement as this would adversely affect the quality of life here.
